comments.html: There is an active individual Internet-Draft hotly discussed in the IETF that attempts to select one of the possible link-local next hop variants (known in Bird as link local next hop format single) and adds a BGP capability to inform the peer that this is supported:
comments.name: Erik Auerswald

comments.html:
I tried this in Netlab, a static BGP session to fe80::1 does not come up in FRR (with advertisements still enabled) - there is an error about setting the next hop.

Interface neighbors to both leaves (each having fe80::1/64 statically assigned) do come up

Some templates needed tweaking to statically assign a link-local ipv6 address - missing test case...
